locale.message: Shibboleth Authentication Plugin
This plugin allows third-party authentication via a Shibboleth service.
With this plugin enabled, a Shibboleth single sign-on service can be used to register and authenticate users. You must have set up and configured the local service provider (SP).
Shibboleth SP path
Please enter the path of the Shibboleth wayfinder service on this server. (e.g. Shibboleth.sso/Login)
HTTP Header ($_SERVER environment variable key) with Shibboleth UIN
Please enter the header in which the Shibboleth UIN is found.
HTTP Header ($_SERVER environment variable key) with Shibboleth first or given name
Please enter the header in which the Shibboleth given name is found.
HTTP Header ($_SERVER environment variable key) with Shibboleth last, family, or surname
Please enter the header in which the Shibboleth surname is found.
HTTP Header ($_SERVER environment variable key) with Shibboleth personal initials
HTTP Header ($_SERVER environment variable key) with Shibboleth e-mail address
Please enter the header in which the Shibboleth e-mail address is found.
HTTP Header ($_SERVER environment variable key) with Shibboleth telephone number
HTTP Header ($_SERVER environment variable key) with Shibboleth postal mailing address

Optional Shibboleth Login

Selecting this option gives user the option of logging in with either a local account or a Shibboleth account. This is useful if your journal will have guest users who don't have a Shibboleth account but would still like to contribute.
